settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Configure LLM, VectorDB, MCP, and other settings.

version.title: Version Information
version.upToDate: You are using the latest version

language.title: Language

chatWidth.previewText: This is a preview of the chat message. Adjust the slider to set your preferred width.

notification.title: Notification Settings
notification.description: Manage notification display method and testing

type.label: Notification Type
type.osDesc: Uses the operating system's notification center. You can receive notifications even when the app is minimized.
type.appDesc: Displays a designed notification within the app. Useful only when the app is visible on screen.

test.title: Notification Test
test.description: Send a test notification with the selected notification type.

quickinput.title: Quick Input

questions.title: Quick Questions (Max 5)
questions.description: Instantly ask questions and get answers based on clipboard content.

questions.descriptionClipboard: ‚Ä¢ Clipboard Content: Sent as user message to be processed.
questions.descriptionExample: e.g., Prompt "Korean to English, English to Korean" ‚Üí Translates clipboard text.
questions.name: Name
questions.promptPlaceholder: e.g., Korean to English, English to Korean
questions.promptDescription: System message that defines the role or instructions for the LLM.
questions.promptDescriptionClipboard: Clipboard content is sent as a separate user message to be processed.

validation.duplicateShortcut: The shortcut for "{{name}}" conflicts with another shortcut.
validation.maxQuestionsReached: You can only register up to 5 Quick Questions.

quickinput.shortcutHint: Click the field and press the key combination you want to use
quickinput.shortcutRecordingHint: Press the key combination you want to use, or press Escape to cancel

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.tabSizeDescription: Set the number of spaces for tab character

defaults.explainCode: Please explain what the following code does. Be concise and clear.
defaults.fixCode: Analyze and fix potential bugs in the following code. Return only the fixed code with brief comments explaining the issues and solutions.
defaults.improveCode: Improve the readability, performance, and maintainability of the following code. Return only the improved code with brief comments on major changes.
defaults.completeCode: Complete the following code based on the context. Return only the completion without explanations.
defaults.addComments: Add clear and concise comments to the following code. Write comments in English explaining the intent and logic of the code.
defaults.generateTest: Generate unit tests for the following code. Use an appropriate testing framework for the language.
defaults.continueWriting: Continue writing the following text naturally. Maintain the context and style.
defaults.makeShorter: Summarize the following text while keeping the key points.
defaults.makeLonger: Expand the following text with more detail and richness. Include additional explanations or examples.
defaults.simplify: Rewrite the following text in simpler and easier to understand language.
defaults.fixGrammar: Fix spelling and grammar errors in the following text. Return only the corrected text.
defaults.summarize: Summarize the key points of the following content concisely.
defaults.translate: Translate the following text to {targetLanguage}. Use natural expressions.

font.title: Chat Font
font.sizeDescription: Set the chat message font size
font.familyDescription: Set the chat message font family

snapshotsPath.title: Snapshots Path
snapshotsPath.description: Folder where page snapshots are saved

skills.title: Skills System
skills.description:
Skills enhance AI agents by injecting domain specific knowledge.
You can download community-created skills from the marketplace or create your own.
skills.localImportGuide: Inside each skill folder, either provide <1>manifest.json</1> (or <3>skill.json</3>) + <5>content.json</5>, or just a single <7>SKILL.md/skill.md</7> file to register/update a skill.
skills.userSkillsFolderDesc: After selecting a folder, scan recursively discovers skill folders and bulk registers/updates them (e.g., .claude/skills layout).

strategies.version: Version Priority (Latest modification time if same version)

skills.includeHidden: Scan hidden directories (starting with .) as well (required for paths like .claude)
skills.installedSkillsDesc: Manage installed skills and enable/disable them.

toasts.importError: An error occurred while registering local skill.
toasts.saveFolderFailed: Failed to save user skills folder.
toasts.saveFolderError: An error occurred while setting user skills folder.
toasts.scanFailed: Failed to scan user skills folder.
toasts.scanPartialDesc: {{imported}} registered/updated, {{failed}} failed out of {{scanned}} targets ({{deduplicated}} deduplicated){{failureExample}}
toasts.scanNoSkillsDesc: Check folders that contain manifest.json (or skill.json) + content.json, or a SKILL.md/skill.md file. If the path is under .claude, enable hidden-directory scanning as well.
toasts.scanError: An error occurred while scanning user skills folder.
toasts.saveStrategyFailed: Failed to save duplicate skill selection strategy.
toasts.saveHiddenOptionFailed: Failed to save hidden folder scan option.

noSkills.title: No Installed Skills
noSkills.description: Download skills from the marketplace or install them locally.

local.label: Local Skills
local.desc: Skills added manually from local folder

deleteDialog.title: Remove Skill
deleteDialog.desc: Are you sure you want to remove <1>{{name}}</1> skill?

skills.skillGuideDescription: You can create a skill with just one SKILL.md (or skill.md) file.
skills.skillGuideSummary:
The recommended format is Markdown-based SKILL.md.
- Scanning recursively traverses subfolders
- Format 1: manifest.json/skill.json + content.json
- Format 2 (recommended): SKILL.md/skill.md (+ YAML frontmatter)
Tip: If your skills are in hidden folders such as .claude, turn on 'Scan hidden directories'.
skills.skillGuideExample:
---
id: local.react-reviewer
name: React Reviewer
version: 1.0.0
author: Your Name
description: Skill focused on React code reviews
category: web-development
tags:
  - react
  - review
contextPatterns:
  - react
  - code review
systemPrompt: |
  Prioritize React review criteria: performance, accessibility, and maintainability.
---

# Review Checklist
- Check state management patterns
- Suggest rendering optimization points
- Verify missing test coverage

teamDocs.title: Team Docs
teamDocs.tokenRequired: Please enter GitHub Personal Access Token.
teamDocs.tokenDescription: üí° Token is stored locally only and is not synced to GitHub. repo permission is required.
teamDocs.docsPathDescription: Folder path to fetch documents from GitHub repository (default: sepilot/documents)
teamDocs.noConfigsHint: Add new Team Docs to sync team documents.
teamDocs.usage1: You can fetch team documents from multiple GitHub repositories
teamDocs.usage2: Each Team Docs is managed independently and stored in VectorDB
teamDocs.usage3: Can be used for RAG search separately from Personal Docs
teamDocs.usage4: Sync latest documents anytime with Pull button

personalDocs.title: Personal Docs
personalDocs.configurationDesc: Configure a GitHub repository to sync personal documents. This setting is shared with other GitHub Sync features.
personalDocs.enableSyncDesc: When enabled, documents in the specified repository will be automatically synced.
personalDocs.note: Personal Docs is a space to store and sync personal notes and documents. Securely back up via GitHub Sync settings and access across devices.

githubSync.title: GitHub Connection Settings
githubSync.description: Connect to repository using GitHub Personal Access Token.
githubSync.ghesUrlDescription: Enter the base URL of your GHES instance (e.g., https://github.company.com)
githubSync.tokenDescription: Personal Access Token with 'repo' scope is required.

errorReporting.title: Automatic Error Reporting
errorReporting.description: Automatically report errors to GitHub Issues to help improve the program.
errorReporting.enableDescription:
Automatically create GitHub Issues when errors occur.
Includes error messages, stack traces, and system info. No personal data included.
errorReporting.info1: Error messages and stack traces are sent to GitHub Issues.
errorReporting.info2: Basic system info (App version, OS) is included.
errorReporting.info3: Sensitive info (API keys, Tokens) is NEVER sent.
errorReporting.info4: This information is vital for program improvement.
errorReporting.info5: This feature is only available when GitHub Token is set.

security.title: üîí Security Info
security.item1: Sensitive info (LLM keys, etc.) is encrypted with AES-256-GCM.
security.item2: GitHub Token is stored locally and NOT synced.
security.item3: Synced files are stored in 'sepilot/' folder.
security.item4: Please be mindful of privacy when syncing conversations/images.

backup.title: Backup/Restore
backup.exportDescription: Export all conversations and messages to XML file.
backup.importDescription: Restore conversations from XML backup file.
backup.warning1: Import adds to existing conversations (does not overwrite)
backup.warning2: Duplicate IDs will be updated with latest data
backup.warning3: Page will automatically refresh after import

documentDialog.systemPrompt: You are a professional AI assistant specialized in document editing and improvement.

prompts.refine:
Refine the following text to extract only the core content and remove unnecessary content. Write it cleanly in markdown format:

{{text}}
prompts.translateKo:
Translate the following text naturally into Korean:

{{text}}
prompts.translateEn:
Translate the following text naturally into English:

{{text}}
prompts.translateJa:
Translate the following text naturally into Japanese:

{{text}}
prompts.expand:
Expand the content of the following text in more detail and richness. Include additional explanations and examples:

{{text}}
prompts.shorten:
Summarize the following text concisely, leaving only the core content:

{{text}}
prompts.improve:
Improve the readability and quality of the following text. Improve grammar, expression, structure and write more clearly:

{{text}}
prompts.verify:
Verify the content of the following text and analyze if there are any factual errors or logical contradictions. If there are problems, point them out, and if not, reply with "Verification complete: No issues":

{{text}}

translator.name: Translator
translator.systemPrompt: You are a professional translator. Accurately and naturally translate the text provided by the user. Consider context and paraphrase when necessary, but accurately convey the meaning of the original text. Omit unnecessary explanations beyond translation and provide only the translation result. If additional explanations are needed beyond the translation result, write them in English.

english-teacher.name: English Teacher
english-teacher.systemPrompt: You are a kind and professional English teacher. Help students learn English. Provide grammar explanations, vocabulary learning, writing corrections, conversation practice, etc., and explain in a way that students can easily understand. Correct mistakes and explain why they are wrong. Write all explanations and answers in English.

senior-developer.name: Senior Developer
senior-developer.systemPrompt: You are a senior software engineer with over 10 years of experience. Provide advice on code reviews, architecture design, technical decision-making, best practices, etc. Provide practical, experience-based answers and clearly explain trade-offs. Write all answers in English.

messageSubscription.title: Message Subscription
messageSubscription.description: Subscribe to messages from external API server and receive notifications

queue.maxQueueSizeDesc: Set the maximum size of the message queue
queue.retentionDaysDesc: Number of days to retain completed messages
queue.retryAttemptsDesc: Number of retry attempts on processing failure

ai.useAIProcessingDesc: When enabled, messages are summarized by AI. When disabled, original content is displayed.

notification.showDesc: Display notification when new message is processed
notification.typeGlobalDesc: Notification type is managed in global Settings > Notification.

queueViewer.title: Queue Management
queueViewer.description: View and manage message queue status

guide.purposeBody: This operational page helps you quickly recover failed messages, prevent queue buildup, and keep your message automation pipeline stable.

integrationItems.connection: Configure API URL and auth token first in Message Subscription > Connection settings, then monitor queue health here.
integrationItems.autoProcess: When auto-process is enabled, incoming messages are processed immediately, and failed jobs can be retried from this page.
integrationItems.recovery: Review each failed error, then reprocess to validate whether external issues (expired auth, temporary outage, etc.) are resolved.
integrationItems.monitoring: Run completed-message cleanup regularly, and if backlog grows, review polling interval and external API status together.

apiFormat.title: API Response Standard Format
apiFormat.description: External API must respond in the following format

subscription.title: Message Subscription Guide
subscription.description: Message Subscription connects your app to an external service so new messages are fetched on schedule and processed automatically.
subscription.whatItDoesBody: It polls your configured API URL, stores incoming messages in the queue, and links processing results to notifications and conversations.

steps.step1: Enter the API URL and polling interval in Connection settings.
steps.step2: Add an auth token if needed, then click Save.
steps.step3: Click "Start Subscription" in the top-right to enable it.
steps.step4: Use the manual refresh button to verify connectivity and message intake immediately.

queue.title: Queue Management Guide
queue.description: Queue Management lets you track processing status, recover failed items, and clean up unnecessary queue data.
queue.whatItDoesBody: It shows pending/processing/completed/failed counts and supports reprocessing failures, deleting messages, and cleaning old completed records.

steps.step1: Check the top status cards to understand current queue backlog.
steps.step2: Open the Failed tab, review errors, and try "Reprocess".
steps.step3: Use "Delete" for items that should not be processed.
steps.step4: Run "Cleanup Completed Messages" periodically for storage and performance hygiene.

guide.title: Message Subscription Guide
guide.description: You can review what this page does, why it exists, how to use it, and how to integrate it with external systems.
guide.purposeBody: Message Subscription periodically fetches messages from an external API, stores them in SEPilot queue, and can continue to AI processing and notifications automatically.

usageSteps.step1: In Connection settings, enter API URL, polling interval, and auth token, then save.
usageSteps.step2: Click Start Subscription in the top-right to activate collection.
usageSteps.step3: Adjust processing policies in Queue/AI settings (retry, auto-process, summarization mode).
usageSteps.step4: Choose whether to show completion notifications in Notification settings.

integrationSteps.step1: Prepare an external endpoint that returns message list JSON payloads.
integrationSteps.step2: If authentication is required, configure Bearer token or custom headers.
integrationSteps.step3: Use manual refresh first to validate connectivity and incoming data.
integrationSteps.step4: Use Queue Management to reprocess/delete failed items for stable operations.
